post.body: @gscottevans bought pathfinder, it's pretty cool. still use bash a lot, though. and versions for svn http://versionsapp.com/
good hint, looks a lot more powerful than Finder.
that's an impressive movie, but the revenge theme is extremely intense.
join the group of late starters, I started twittering a month ago. :)
That's where the iPhone shines, probably the most convenient device for accessing the Internet and RSS readers on the walk.
is that a new MacBookPro? My one had problems with an external display and stand-by mode.
haven't been to happy with the virtual keyboard, typing on the Blackberry keyboard is faster. But Safari is the better browser.
Some things are just easier to do with a keyboard, but the browser pretty much sucks.
and the reason for switching to Blackberry is that T-Mobile blocks data access for hacked foreign iPhones :-(
Yes, that's true, the price tag is relatively high. I switched from iPhone to Blackberry, so I'm using Twitterberry...
Hope you have more luck for the rest of the day. :)
That's when the fun with coding begins! Exactly what I'm looking forward to as well. :)
Skiing with Jung-Hyun in Garmisch (German Alps).
The end of the year 2008! I wish everyone a happy and successful year 2009! Cheers :)
Reading Antun's blog post on OpenLaszlo performance with the SWF9 runtime at http://tinyurl.com/7frn6z
Drinking tea with my parents at home, relaxing.
Christmas breakfast with my parents and my brother!
On the plane, awaiting Christmas at my parents house, for the first time in years.
Just installed Twitterrific, cool tool.
To everyone out there: have a happy Christmas and holiday season 2008!
